website_summaries.verdict: A staircase entry ladder that is very solid to use, even for larger people.
pros: Sand makes these stairs very sturdy
Made from a heavy gauge plastic
cons: Filling the base with sand is not easy
Placing sand in buckets or pipes underneath is a practical alternative

customer_reviews.title: Awesome set of pool steps
customer_reviews.text: Awesome set of pool steps, i filled three hawian punch jugs full of sand with a 3 foot pipe stuck through the handles instead of fillng the ladder full of sand, stuck the pipe thru the middle holes of the ladder underneath, and with my kids and the neighbors kids wearin it out, it held up just fine without scooting on the floor of the pool, can yu imagine trying to pull that thing outta the pool filled with sand, now i just have to reach down and pull the pipe out, grab the jugs and lift the ladder right out without having to have a crane pull it out.
customer_reviews.author: bomark2002

customer_reviews.title: The only steps to get are these AAAAAAA+++++++++
customer_reviews.text: This is the best steps on the market today my wife and I have look at over 40 different ones and the rails are not flimsy mounted them to my deck and we put 70 lbs of sand and it doesn't move we have a friend that's 450lbs and the steps hold him and doesn't bend I can not say anything bad or unhappy with the step thanks again very nice
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Roy Pardo

customer_reviews.title: Great above ground pool upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: Great steps and design. Modified the 4 steps to be 3. Need to follow assembly instructions, but they are well written and detailed. Mfg recommends removing for winter. Just took them out on Labor Day. A little tricky, but not horrible. Frame is filled with sand. No sand leaked during installation, use, or removal.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph P.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT ABOVE GROUND POOL STEPS SO FAR
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pool steps nice and sturdy. Instead of filling steps with sand I filled two 4"x24" PVC pipes with cement and capped them. I then attached them to the side of the steps with large heavy duty black Zip Ties. So when you close for the summer clip the ties and easily pool the steps out of the pool for storage.
customer_reviews.author: SG1BORICUA

customer_reviews.title: Help I am stuck (my polaris, and possibly your child)...
customer_reviews.text: These steps are nice. However every cleaner I have had gets stuck on these steps. I finally broke down and bought a Polaris 360. It cleans great! Until it gets near the gap in the back of the stairs. Then it is stuck. Really stuck. I called Confer in Canada and was informed that others have called about this problem too. But they have no fix. Then I find out that there is a hazard to this product about children getting trapped and possibly drowning.
customer_reviews.author: Two Guys Two Rotten Dogs and the RV

customer_reviews.title: Most rvws based on ladder with holes on both sides allowing flow of water n pvc pipes w sandbuckets
customer_reviews.text: I have not put this in the water yet. I wanted to follow what a lot of people did using the PVC pipe and 3 gallon buckets filled with sand. I was disappointed when the stairs arrived and all the side holes were filled in. But I understand why because of the recall and August 2018 when a small child’s arm was stuck in one of the holes. I am going to try to carve out a couple holes so I can fit a PVC pipe through. I think it will be fine. They actually sent out kits so people could do this themselves after the recall. Does anyone have any suggestions or comments or advice? Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: We are so happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: We are so happy with this purchase. We did fill it with sand and left it in the pool all winter. It has not discolored. This makes getting in and out of the pool so much easier on these old hips. We built a set of stairs out side of the pool and screwed the arms of the pool steps to our wooden steps.
customer_reviews.author: P. Lokovic

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty...Everyone was able to get in and out of the pool with ease.  Watch the assembly video!
customer_reviews.text: Fits beautifully into our above ground pool....I don't know why we didn't get them much sooner! We did read the reviews listed with the product and found very helpful hints to weight them down and assemble them. Be sure to make weights with 3-4" pipe with sand and seal both ends to weight them down. This makes it much easier to clip the cable ties at then end of season and take the steps out and your weights are split up to take from the pool. Rubber mallet to assemble and do watch the video to see how they assemble. Great heavy duty steps...Everyone was able to get in and out of the pool with ease!
customer_reviews.author: Debra Meredith

customer_reviews.title: Like putting together a giant tinker toy.
customer_reviews.text: It was like putting together a tinker toy or an erector set. After watching the video showing the construction I was disappointed as to how challenging it was. The only reason I elected to purchase was because I did not see the one piece wedding cake steps listed until after this was purchased. After struggling with putting it together getting it into the pool and secured was not as simple as indicated. I would recommend purchasing the one piece unit that only requires attaching the rail. We had that previously but needed to replace due to my failure to remove from pool for winter closing (causing it to crack).
customer_reviews.author: John J. Schubert

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: These steps are great! The ladder that came with out pool was pure garbage. Which made getting in and out of the pool an adventure. Now with these steps and some custom deck stairs, getting in and out of the pool is a non event. We ended up filling two food grade buckets with concrete and replaced the handles with nylon rope. Ran a piece of PVC pipe through the back slots of the steps, with a piece of metal inside to support the buckets. Then sealed the PVC pipe. This will make it super easy to bring the steps in during the winter rather than filling them with sand/rocks.
customer_reviews.author: C. Mills

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THEM BUT WATCH THE ALGEA BUILDUP! WILL COST ALOT TO FIX
customer_reviews.text: I loved these stairs for the first season and half of the next until my pool started getting an algea around it and the stairs. After almost 4 months of fighting the problem we found the sand in the stairs hold all of the bad bacteria's and continues to turn green. Removing the steps and the sand has become a big problem, because like others have said putting it in was hard and wet sand doesn't want to come out. Pool service has warned that these can cause problems with maintaining good water conditions. Just a warning to all! I still love the way I can get in and out of my pool after several back surgeries.
customer_reviews.author: DARLENE

customer_reviews.title: Attracts Algae
customer_reviews.text: This is year 2 of having these steps. We loved them last year, because they were easy to get in and out of the pool. I hated having to weigh it down with the buckets, but that is the only way to keep them down without filling them with sand. This year we have only been able to swim in our pool 3 times. We can't keep it clean. We have spent hundreds on chemicals only to find out that our ladder is full of algae. This is a waste of money as I will now have to buy a different set of steps.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Delaune

customer_reviews.title: Use alternate method to weight the steps
customer_reviews.text: Read the other reviews that recommend alternate methods to weigh down the stairs. Rather than loading it with 40 pounds of sand like the manufacturer recommends, we use 40 pounds of plastic sealed weight plates (that had been unused for their original purpose for several years). This will enable easy removal of the plates and then the stairs in the fall. We used a hard floor plastic desk mat under the stairs to protect the pool liner. They seem very very sturdy. And are easy to get into and out of the pool.
customer_reviews.author: mesmolin

customer_reviews.title: Definite upgrade over standard metal stairs.
customer_reviews.text: The ladder that came with our above ground pool was either too skinny or we're too wide. Suitable for youngsters, but just did not feel stable enough for us. The Confer Curve Steps were just what we needed. Amazingly easy to assemble. Somewhere we read to weigh the stairs down with sand. I was not too keen on that fearing the sand might leak into the pool somehow. We bought some inexpensive lifting weights at the local sporting goods store and a heavy plastic tube from the hardware store and use those to weigh the stairs. No floating stairs. The product is very well made and certainly upgraded our pool. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A. Porter

customer_reviews.title: Very solid and steady stairs.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using these steps to get into my above ground pool. The sides are 56", and these steps are great. The top step is just slightly underwater. The only thing I would change is the method for weighting them down. Using sand doesn't work well when you have to take the steps out at the end of the pool season. I ended up using zip ties to attach 40 lbs of neoprene dumbbells under the steps. Next season, I'll use 50 lbs, and attach them lower for better stability. But, that is not a complaint, just a suggestion. These steps are excellent!!
customer_reviews.author: Gene Flore

customer_reviews.title: Handrails aren't sturdy at all
customer_reviews.text: Overall easy to put together. A rubber mallet is your friend with this one. Sturdy except for handrails which is why I gave it a one star rating. They pop out way too easy and don't fit as tightly as the other pieces do. Don't buy this if you need the handrails to pull yourself up or lean on too much. Mine pop out all the time and aren't sturdy. I was very disappointed considering the price I paid. Instructions for assembly are well written with pictures as well. About an hour and a half and some patience and I put it together by myself
customer_reviews.author: Susan315ny

customer_reviews.title: Do your research....flawed design
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this because I hated my pool ladder and wanted sturdy pool steps. Major headache to assemble alone so have a buddy if you decide to purchase. 2 flaws, the feet were a PIA to get on and never stay on! The sand you need to put in takes forever the holes are small and amusing a funnel is pointless. I like that it is made in America BUT it needs to be redesigned for this price. I thought I did my research, I would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Siobhan

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty close to perfect. The steps themselves are very sturdy. They went together easily. With the appropriate amount of sand, they stay put. They make getting in and out of the pool so much easier and safer than a ladder. I won't use a ladder in my pool ever again. My only gripe if I had to have one is that the railings are wobbly. Not so much you're afraid to use them, but enough you definitely take notice, probably because the rest of the step is so solid. But other than that, these are fantastic. My family highly recommends.
customer_reviews.author: N. McBride

customer_reviews.title: But once I put the sand in they are perfect for our kayak pool
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t get any of the ‘hacks’ for weighing down the stairs to work. But once I put the sand in they are perfect for our kayak pool. I did have to put a pressure treated 2X4 under the braces because of the height of my deck but we love these stairs. Great seller too! My rails had weak spots in them where you could almost see through the plastic. Seller immediately sent replacements.
customer_reviews.author: k lowe

customer_reviews.title: Very stable and surprisingly attractive. Everyone that used them liked them.
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly, took about 45 minutes, and very solid/stable when installed with weights. Looks like they will hold up well unless the sunlight destroys the plastic. I used zip ties to easily attach weights I made by filling and capping 3 inch PVC pipe using saturated sand. If not in a hurry, I probably would have used concrete instead of sand but did not want to wait for it to set. The weights hang under the steps and are not seen at all while in the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Rick T

customer_reviews.title: Great Steps-Customer Service not so much
customer_reviews.text: The steps came in a box that looked like all the pieces were thrown together in the box. No instructions. Had to look it up online. The steps are nice and go well with our pool. Customer service wasn’t nice. I bought the steps and then a few days later (after it had already shipped). The price was lowered well over $100.00. When I contacted customer service about a refund for the difference, I was told no I told them I guess when I get it I’ll ship it back. They said ok, do that. So, in order for me to get the difference, I had to ship the entire box back. That’s bull!
customer_reviews.author: sltrawick

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good replacement
customer_reviews.text: the handrails seem a little flimsy and while are better than the ladder set-up that came with the pool, I wish there was a way to firm them up - even connected to deck as designed they may not hold a person that depends on them for stability - jury is still out. I do have to call the company as one of the steps split at the injection mold line and I need a replacement - just not sure who to call - minor issue but an issue. Overall pretty good and again better than what we had that broke after 16 years
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: The only set of pool steps worth buying....
customer_reviews.text: Could not be easier to put together.... super sturdy, don’t wobble or flex.... great product.... I did fill mine with San as recommended BUT had I real the reviews before hand... I would have used the 3-5 gallon bucket attachment approach... once attached to my deck... there is no coming loose.... Well worth the money... no tools required other than a rubber hammer....
customer_reviews.author: DP935

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: These stairs were shipped quickly and in sturdy packaging. They were easy to assemble. The stairs will float and require something to weight them down. If you don't want to go the sand in the stairs route, I recommend a skinny pvc pipe threaded behind the steps with a 3 gallon water jugs full of sand. That makes it easy to remove when time to cover the pool for winter. The three jugs has been enough to keep the stairs in place for this entire season!
customer_reviews.author: Regina

customer_reviews.title: Need more weight but overall satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was ok. Putting sand in was very slow going they need to improve this step along with it didn't hold it down still had to add weight by tying to it to hold down hold. Like the design feels sturdy enough and my 2 year old grandson had no difficulties in getting in out of pool so with that I'd recommend but realize need add weight and set asi6a few hours to put together. I bought both steps instructions could've been setup better
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Bolte

customer_reviews.title: Best Steps Around!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! We also didn't fill the inside of the steps. We took gallon plastic jars and filled them with cement and then fastened them to the steps with tie wraps to keep the steps weighted down. Works perfect and so easy to remove these when storing for the winter. The steps were pretty easy to install and customer service is the best you can find!
customer_reviews.author: Margie

customer_reviews.title: Not quite as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the “grey” stairs which were actually beige with grey steps. The “feet” that the unit rests on did not attach to the stairs the way that the instructions showed. We ended up drilling holes in the bottom and attaching them with a screw and washer. Not a big deal, but if not done properly, could possibly effect the integrity of the stairs (ability to hold sand). We don’t plan to fill it with sand, and plan to use cylinder weights instead. I will update this review once we get it into the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Tammie Packard

customer_reviews.title: Great for my above ground pool
customer_reviews.text: Love these steps. These change the dynamic of my pool now - instead of an ugly, clumsy ladder: I have these nice steps. They do float. I had to add 30 pounds of weight just to keep the steps from floating, They'll still move when the water is jostled. I expected that - we're supposed to put sand in them - so that's all me. I'm going to add some more to make them more stable.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph R Earley

customer_reviews.title: Great concept but, won’t stay in one place.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for safely getting in and out of the pool. I could not get it to stay put in one place a attached weights all over on it and it still moved. I have a lot of rambunctious kids creating waves that would move it all around the pool. Don’t really recommend for highly active pools.
customer_reviews.author: Elby

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Holy crap these are solid. I needed something to get my handicapped son out of our Intex 26'x54" deep pool and this is perfect. He and I together weigh about 320lbs and it doesnt flex at all. Took me about 30 minutes to put together. Directions where very helpful, all the pieces fit great and it fit our pool perfect, we have a deck around our pool and there is about a 6" step from the top of the last step to the deck.
customer_reviews.author: Bighunter

customer_reviews.title: So glad we bought these stairs!
customer_reviews.text: When we first got our above ground pool we had to use a ladder up and down.. it was hard for grandparents and our toddler. We put a deck around the pool last year and bought these steps to walk in and now it's safer and easier for all. My daughter loves to hang out on them also since there is no shallow end. I recommend filling with sand or getting sand bags.. we pulled plugs so it would fill up with water but it wasn't enough.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great quality... love.
customer_reviews.text: Love the design. The plastic doesn’t have any cracks/touch spots... super smooth in your feet/legs. It has a couple of options for set up, so 4 sets of instructions were included & you have to choose which to use. We tried the 50lbs of sand & it floated. Then we added over a 100 (we couldn’t fit more inside) & it still lifted off the bottom & moved some! My husband made blocks of wood to place under the 2 braces & screwed them to the deck... it doesn’t move!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the stairs
customer_reviews.text: These are great. My kids love to play on them and have enough room for others to get into pool. My husband didn’t have any issues assembling. Don’t read complaints that state had to get sand. DUH yes it like ANY pool ladder must be weighted down or drill holes in it like we do and let water fill up and it weights down it self! Buy it, you won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Love the ladder...Handrails a bit flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: Love this ladder. I added the sand as recommended and put into pool. Let the pieces that need to fill with water so it would settle, then I screwed it to my deck. I have a cartridge filter for my and the water that come out the return is fast. This ladder doesn’t move. Not sure what everyone else that had issues with it floating. I don’t think I will need any special weights added to it. Would be 5 stars if not for handrails. They should be made with the same sturdy plastic the stair steps are made form.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M.

customer_reviews.title: Great steps!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just put these together with the help of my 15 yr old son and we did it in 20 minutes!!! They look great. We did make some home made weights out of 2 pvc tubes and 50lbs of sand to help with the weight but it worked perfectly. Assembly was a piece of cake!!! There is a video out there on YouTube on putting them together which lasts I believe 5 minutes. I watched the video and put it together easily. It's the best value I could find out there for this price point!!!
customer_reviews.author: BEN RAINEY

customer_reviews.title: Not beige!
customer_reviews.text: FYI-Not beige!! If you are looking for a beige ladder this is not it! Bought for my brown/tan pool and it’s a cream/off white color! Not happy! Other than the color, it seems nice and sturdy. Gonna go with it...
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Roberts

customer_reviews.title: The curve base steps are great, They are sturdy and don't move once anchored ...
customer_reviews.text: We just got the pool. So we wanted wide steps. The curve base steps are great, They are sturdy and don't move once anchored to the deck. We also put weights on the back of the steps. We also put the stairs in when we were filling the pool. But you do need weights on the back. We used kettle bell weights with zip ties. SO Happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: karen mac

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love these steps
customer_reviews.text: Just put together and I absolutely love these steps. Was very easy to put together with minimal time. Used 70 lbs. of sand inside of plastic pipes and wa la....very heavy, very steardy, perfection. I would highly recomend this product and this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Belinda Reeves

customer_reviews.title: We ordered the complete system (both the steps and the ...
customer_reviews.text: We ordered the complete system (both the steps and the curved steps) because we wanted a larger space to get up and down for our dog and my mother who occasionally swims with the grandchildren. We only had the steps delivered and haven’t had any response from the seller about ever receiving the rest. It only shows everything was delivered. In reality, only half was delivered. I would have never paid this much for just a pool ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Amy OBryan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect but floats.
customer_reviews.text: Everything about these is great. We bought them so us parents and my disabled son could get in and out easier. We took advice and filled 2 tubes with concrete and attached them. We used a total of 75 lbs and they still tip/float. We have done every suggestion on here. We just readjust but it is annoying. Thats the only reason for 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Solid steps for heavy people
customer_reviews.text: These are much better steps than the stairs that come with above ground pools. We have a large family and a lot of the people that come over are bigger so this works great! We bought two sets and hooked one up to the deck and the other inside the pool up to the little deck/platform we built out of wood. It works great and we have been using them a couple years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had more hands so I could give it 4 thumbs down
customer_reviews.text: This is easily one of the worst pool ladders I have ever encountered. It is a hassle to assemble and you have to practically nail it down to keep it from floating away. After 2 Saturdays of trying to get this stupid thing to stay under I put it on Craigslist and gave it away for free. And yes, I followed the directions
customer_reviews.author: Charlie's Angel

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: Had to work at the assembly, but I guess if you want them to be sturdy it is expected to be a hard fit. Had to have my son help me, he is stronger than I am. Directions said to use dish liquid to help snap together, that was a big help. I love these steps better than the cupcake steps I had before.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice stable stair, took 20 minutes to build
customer_reviews.text: The ladder was easy to assemble and worked like a charm. My pool is 54" tall with an exterior deck. The top step is just above the water line and the straps that attach it to the deck are height adjustable. The only issue was even with 40lbs of sand inside, it took a minute to sink the steps. We ended up bringing it into the pool and rotating it around to get the air out. Made my family and dogs happy now that there is a stable entrance to the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Turnley

customer_reviews.title: Great stairs but bad design
customer_reviews.text: The stairs are very stable and perfect for what we wanted. My only complaint is that stuff gets trapped underneath them and algae loves to grow under them. You have to use something to weigh them down so once they’re in place there’s no moving them to clean behind.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: ... and down ladders are difficult -- this is very easy and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I'm arthritic and the straight up and down ladders are difficult -- this is very easy and sturdy. Used another customer's suggestion and took plastic pipe from the hardware store and filled with sand instead of filling the stairs themselves. Filled the pipes with sand and capped them off (instead of concrete as he had suggested) and attached with zip ties. Worked perfectly!!! Easy to clean - love them!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy from South Windsor, CT

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy steps that can hold heavier people.
customer_reviews.text: We bought these steps because we have some heavy family members. If you're looking for a sturdy, well made set of steps, look no further. These have held up well for us this year and I expect no less over the next several years. They look great and are so much more durable than our previous steps were. Plus we love that we no longer have to worry about how to keep them down. The sand works great.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Pool Stairs
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant about buying this pool ladder for our above ground pool. Glad I purchased it. My husband put it together with my help in about 30 minutes or so - A little tricky. The height on the stair is 11" - it is high but I'm a big woman with bad knees and I am able to get out no problem. We have the ladder screwed to wood stairs my husband made, it does not float up much - we did not fill it with sand. I'm very happy with these stairs.
customer_reviews.author: D.G.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful look and excellent function
customer_reviews.text: I love these stairs!! My husband used a round piece of hardwood slid through the hole and hung a bucket with 50 pounds of pool filter sand on it. It took 4 of us to hold the stairs under water...until he decided to take the taps off the sand tubes. Once we did that it sank like magic! Love them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great pool steps.
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised when I began assembling this step unit. Everything went together very easily. The directions was easy to follow. The only thing I had difficulty was attaching the foot pads. No matter how many times I hit them with the mallet they wouldn't go on. I solved this problem by using long wood working clamps to hold them in place while I was able to rap them firmly with the mallet. I also contacted the company for winterizing instructions. They answered my question within the hour.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth E. Thompson Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Stairs
customer_reviews.text: Very nice looking and well made pool steps! Super easy to put together! We did Zip tie it to the pool because ours is not level to the deck. Kid and 75 year old Dad approved!!!! Best purchase for our pool!!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Everyone loves these stairs! I can’t say enough good things about them. Easy to remove too. I did it all by myself and I’m no spring chicken. You can sit on them and people can still get by. So easy to get out of pool now. I just love them! Easy to put together. You will love them too.
customer_reviews.author: Ernestine F. Callahan

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: We have some bigger folks in our family so this ladder has really given them the opportunity to enjoy tim with everyone without worrying. We did end up using a mallet to put this together & it did take multiple people to put it in our pool. Overall very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan/Kylie McLean

customer_reviews.title: Great Pool Steps...great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I love these stairs! I put them together by myself (a grandma) in less than an hour, including filling with sand. During that time I decided to order another set to use on the outside of the pool. I don't have a pool deck yet, so this will make getting in and out so much easier. They are heavy and appear to be very sturdy and durable. There is a world of difference between pool ladders and stairs. So happy with my purchase and can't wait to get the second set. Highly recommend and you can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: Donna L. Grice

customer_reviews.title: The steps were easy to install
customer_reviews.text: The steps were easy to install. The description doesn't make clear that the handrails are included (since there was a separate price for handrails) but they were included. I guess the hand rail price was for the optional side steps that can attach to this unit. I don't like sand in the steps since it makes it so heavy to remove the steps in the off season when you put a cover over the pool. I used kettle bells tied to the lower upright for the handrails with a nylon rope. Works great and can be removed before taking the steps out of the pool for the off season.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great steps and attractive
customer_reviews.text: These steps were exactly what we’ve been looking for! We got them put together in a little over an hour and they fit beautifully in the pool! Looking forward to a summer of fun in the pool, and a much easier entry and exit for me as a member of the ‘older’ generation!
customer_reviews.author: peanut510

customer_reviews.title: Love these steps!
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews...luckily on the part about holding the stairs down. I love these stairs. They were easy to assemble and are very stable. I feel much safer getting out of the pool on these than the ladder style. We did need to weigh the steps down just as other reviews said. We did the buckets with sand behind the ladder. It seemed to work well. We haven’t had a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Iwgarner

customer_reviews.title: sturdiest ladder I have owned for my above ground pool!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice ladder except securing the ladder from the back with approx. 50 lbs of sand weights is absolutely necessary and the front needs small weights to balance out weight. I elected not to fill arms with sand since it would be much too heavy to take out of pool when closing pool for winter. Heavy duty ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have steps instead of a ladder
customer_reviews.text: Originally sent us the wrong steps. But, were very helpful in getting the mistake resolved. It was pretty easy to put together with 2 people if you followed the instructions. Definitely need the rubber mallet and sand. NO problems getting it into the pool. It has held up well for this 1st pool season. We especially like having steps so we can sit with our feet in the water and be part of the pool experience without having to be in with the kids all the time. Great for our sons dogs to get in and out, too.
customer_reviews.author: TEE

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Solid stairs!!We put sand in themAnd weighted them down with bleach bottles filled with sand.Read dimension prior.I had to put them in an awkward spot on my deck because they were gonna cover my slimmer lol.But they are very nice steps
customer_reviews.author: junebug

customer_reviews.title: Very nice pool steps
customer_reviews.text: Very nice pool steps; assembly was reasonably easy, all pieces fit together nicely and the secret to getting them to stay down in the pool is simply to get all the required sand in the steps and carefully rock the steps until there are no more air bubbles to contend with. Only concern I have about these steps are the somewhat flimsy or wobbly hand rests; they do not make you feel very secure and would likely break loose if someone stumbled and fell over on them. Maybe not, but some improvement would be a real plus.. Overall, they are quite sturdy and I am quite pleased so far!
customer_reviews.author: C. Mullins

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: I love the sturdiness of these steps and would give a higher review but we have pieces missing. The bottom foot pad and the lower arm fto connect the railing to. I've contacted the seller through Amazon but I haven't heard anything yet. Hopefully they can send just the 2 pieces we need and I don't have to disassemble the ladder and send back. Seems like it will be a nice set of steps for our above ground pool.
customer_reviews.author: helen

customer_reviews.title: Wide stairs sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I would give these stairs five stars but the only problem we have is the railing. It is flimsy and keeps coming apart in the water. I wish the railings snapped in and stayed snapped in. the stairs are really sturdy they just need to have a better way to snap the railings into the ladder.
customer_reviews.author: AnnMarie Rigby

customer_reviews.title: love them. They are well constructed but I will ...
customer_reviews.text: I installed these a few weeks ago and so far everyone that has seen them and used them, love them. They are well constructed but I will say that I had to install 2 pieces of 2x4 for where the arms attach to the deck because the deck is slightly lower than the pool. If this is the case with yours, just get a small 2x4 and cut as long as the arms extend on the deck and attach them and then the arms to the 2x4s. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Breakall

customer_reviews.title: Keeping it on the bottom of the pool
customer_reviews.text: Really nice looking, sturdy, and easy to use. Only problem is keeping it from floating. Filed with water; still floated. Filled a 32” long 4” diameter PVC pipe with sand and capped it. Then attached it to the front beneath the bottom step. Now OK.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Still floats after filling with sand
customer_reviews.text: I liked how easy these were to put together, but the hand rails keep falling off and the ladder will not stay in place. I am going to weight it down with some containers with sand and it should be ok. Maybe the hand rail will stay on if it stops moving. They do look nice and the stairs them selves are really sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: Most sturdy steps I could find.
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for sturdy steps for above ground pool that would support heavy weight. Love these steps. I really did not need the wedding cake addition. Hand rails are a bit weak. Was missing a part. Confer responded immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Berry

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend these stairs.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these stairs so my 85 year old mom could get in our pool that we replaced last year.They are sturdy & the stairs are wide so she can put her whole foot on the step.We had a ladder on our old pool & she fell!.We bought a mat tp place under the stairs also.
customer_reviews.author: maxine smith

customer_reviews.title: Get help when placing in the pool. I did it alone and it was a little rough.
customer_reviews.text: Good thing to do is smooth the flashing before assembly. It can be a little sharp in places. (Flashing is the squeeze out of the plastic when being molded.) Other than that its a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Well engineered
customer_reviews.text: As I was assembling the stairs it was evident that the company wanted to manufacture an easy to assemble quality step, and they did. They invested time and money into research and engineering. I was going to tie the steps down with weights like the last steps I had but went with the sand instead. I bolted the steps down to my concrete deck and have had no problems with them wanting to move. I purchased a pad to put under the steps but have not installed it because there seems to be no problem. Very happy with the quality and appearance of the stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Kent

customer_reviews.title: Great Pool Steps
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with these steps. Our pool is 18x40 above ground with liner and these steps are perfect. I did opt for the extra curve and I'm so happy I did. The steps have treads and the blue color is beautiful. These were worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia B.

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my pool
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to my pool. Great quality, easy to install and makes it so much easier to get in and out of the pool! Remember to fill it with sand so it adds weight and so it wont move or jiggle too much. I recommend putting buying the pool mat to place underneath the steps as well as some kind of pool noodle behind it so it doesn't wear / tear on your pool liner. Great product, i have recommended this item to a few people already and very affordable compared to other units with horrible reviews. This one is a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: A.C

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived before scheduled delivery date. It was easy to assemble with a rubber mallet. One box did arrive busted open and we were missing the stainless steel screws for the additional side. Nothing we cannot pickup at the local hardware store. This product was worth the money. The pool company wanted to charge us $700 + for steps that looked similar but honestly I don’t believe we’re as nice as these. Highly recommend purchasing these steps.
customer_reviews.author: Memphis

customer_reviews.title: Sand fill the side panels!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and great for ease of entry and exit from the pool. Make sure to fill up the side panels with sand. Use a water hose to force the air pockets out of the pieces. Don’t forget a liner protector piece for them to sit on too. We love them and so do the grandkids!!
customer_reviews.author: KuznKevn

customer_reviews.title: appears to be a very sturdy and stabile pool ladder
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was problematic. It took my wife and son the better part of a week to assemble. But what do you want for this price and quality? Nice wide stairs. You can actually sit on the stairs comfortably. Very stabile. able to climb in and out of the pool without issues. Appears to be very well constructed and strong. We had to place some wood underneath the flanges that were used to attach the ladder to out pool deck.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality - difficult assembly
customer_reviews.text: You need a rubber mallet to put this together. You'll also need 40 lbs of sand. It's a bit of a headache to assemble, but once together, works very well and is very sturdy. Two people are needed for assembly/installation.
customer_reviews.author: dskelly77

customer_reviews.title: Reconsider before buying
customer_reviews.text: Under bottom step there are two plugs to hold the sand in the bottom that you need for weight to stop the steps from floating. The plugs come out easily, therefore sand all over the bottom of your pool. Extremely difficult to obtain the proper size plug for replacement. Would not recommend these merely because of the plugs.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: My grandkids LOVE these steps and so do I! They are very sturdy and well worth the money. They were almost $200 more at our local pool center so I ordered them on Amazon. Even with the sand they will move some, unless you add extra weight (we did) or secure them to a deck. They do have arms that are meant to be secured. I recently had foot surgery and the steps allow me to securely enter and exit our above ground pool.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Vespa

customer_reviews.title: Very solid steps!  I am a big guy and very happy!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy steps. I am a gravitationally challenged guy and these steps are solid. Assembly was as easy as can be expected. We fashioned a shelf behind the steps to hold a plastic gas container filled with sand and water. This was we did not have to fill the steps with sand. We live in the north and have to pull the steps every year to properly close the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Hergatt

customer_reviews.title: Floaters
customer_reviews.text: Love the look of these stairs but they take a good 2-3 maybe 4 hours. We shoved sand in all the areas n used end of a spoon to push sand down compartments but sadly our stairs float. Maybe others will have better luck. They are strong and beautiful but float.
customer_reviews.author: Cafeseniff

customer_reviews.title: Excellent steps
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely wonderful steps! You must however fill them with sand. They will float if you don’t. It’s not hard to do at all. When it is time to close my pool we are going to just tip the steps into the pool and put the winter cover on. I highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Great steps! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Love these steps - they are the best ones we have ever had. We did have to use a weight on them but other than that they are very sturdy, easy to use and we love them! We are both very overweight and these do not "give' under our weight - our kids are all over there all the time and they jump off them as well!
customer_reviews.author: amberg

customer_reviews.title: Overall good buy and easy to build - issue with the railings.
customer_reviews.text: I built these stairs a few days ago - they built out easily, particularly once I got the mallet involved. I am using these as an entry to my swim spa vs an exit from a pool. They are working great. My only issue is that the railings seem to easily pop out if pushed out from the side. Because of how tall the stairs are most kids would be holding on in a way that may pop the railing out. I will work to manually resolve.
customer_reviews.author: Gorachie

customer_reviews.title: Quick shipping! Packaged well! Easy setup!
customer_reviews.text: Quick shipping! Packaged well! Easy setup! The steps are very sturdy but the hand rails leave a little to be desired. Wonder if maybe the manufacture needs to look at putting another brace for the vertical rail posts. Easy setup, took longer to put the sand in the sides than it did to put it together! In and out of the pool is SO MUCH Easier! Our old ladder was 12 years old, hope this one last as long if not longer!!! I would have gave it 5 stars if the railing was sturdier...
customer_reviews.author: Linda Lou

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with these.
customer_reviews.text: Work just as expected nice, heavy duty. Hard to get out in fall, need strong men and several but worth it. Have them sitting on our deck all winter, no issues, holding up well. Really like these for kiddos to sit and rest and push off from. High quality. Worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble but leaked sand all over our pool
customer_reviews.text: Works great in our pool. We actually bought this as a way for our dog to get out of the pool and ended up a great way for all of us to get out of the pool. Very sturdy and easy to set up. The only problem we had was filling it with sand and the sand came out of the air holes.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great value product.
customer_reviews.text: Strong steps, good spacing. Great price. The hand rails could use more stability support as the mounts down in the water move in and out with adult weight. Time will tell as to the longevity of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Merryinside

customer_reviews.title: Solid steps
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. I built an additional step to cover the mounting hardware. For the reviews that said the stairs float the must have ignored the part about tilting to let air out. I put the sand in as instructed and placed it in the water and yes it floated. Tilting it side to side let the air out and it sank to the bottom and has not moved since.
customer_reviews.author: Dave M

customer_reviews.title: Skip these steps
customer_reviews.text: Extremely difficult to assemble and we still haven’t figured it out. The ladder won’t lay flat and continues to rise up out of the water. Dangerous and a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Cloe

customer_reviews.title: This is really very nice, and quite easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This is really very nice, and quite easy to assemble. A little soap on things and a rubber mallet, and presto, you have a well made unit. Very happy with this product. It is a must for above ground pools.. So much easier to get into and out of. Plus the steps look beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: T. Misiewicz

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely sturdy and exactly what we wanted!
customer_reviews.text: These steps are super sturdy and just perfect! Instead of putting sand directly into the steps we used buckets of sand as suggested in other reviews. We used pvc pipe and (2) 5 gallon buckets. We did drill two extra holes in the sides to allow for more air to escape when sinking the steps in the water. That helped it go a little faster and sink better. These steps are well made and they don't budge at all when going up and down. So happy and completely satisfied with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Donette S.

customer_reviews.title: Solid set of stairs!
customer_reviews.text: These were very easy to assemble and have been sturdy all summer. We tried the weighted buckets underneath (described by other reviews) rather than filling with sand because we were concerned about being able to lift them out for the winter. They tend to move around a bit with 2 buckets, but we will try one more bucket next year to see if that holds them in place better. Overall, a great quality set of stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Fournier

customer_reviews.title: My Grands & great Grands love it!
customer_reviews.text: For our above ground pool. It’s better than I expected! Clean, fast transaction! Fast delivery!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia  G. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Works great, alot sturdier than the ladder
customer_reviews.text: Works great, alot sturdier than the ladder. I can actually can get in an out of the pool with worrying about falling off. I am gonna get one for the outside as well. You MUST use sand or pea gravel to weight it down and dont be shy about how much. It's plastic it floats.The people that complain about it floating away didn't weight it down.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great Product-Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Well I just received this product earlier then expected. Perfect timing for the Memorial day weekend. My husband and I poured about 25-30 lbs of sand in each side. The stairs are very strudy and of high quality. I would highly recommend this product. It's also adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good - needs traction on stair edging
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. The sand has a slight leak coming out from the unit (somewhere I can't find so far). The only other problem is - the stair edges need some type of grip with them. Be that a waterproof adhesive strip or something in the molding process. The stair edges are a bit slick and can be a problem for elderly and pets.
customer_reviews.author: ForrestA

customer_reviews.title: They're durable enough for 30 rambunctious adults; if you're worried about the plastic cracking or bending, you needn't be.
customer_reviews.text: Love these, perfectly clear instructions, solid construction, pretty easy install. I have a deck that's slightly lower than the edge of my pool so I had to cut some wood "shims" to fill the gap and used long lag bolts instead of the included hardware. Even with my hamfisted modifications the steps survived a 30 person pool party and are surprisingly easy to clean. I stick a hose behind the steps and blast out any detritus hanging out under them. Thanks to the gaps in the design this works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan W. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: A Very Nice Pool Step
customer_reviews.text: Good value. It's not cheap, but relative to a simple ladder, it's well worth the extra. Delivered quickly, as usual with Amazon. The 'step' was reasonably easy to put together. The feet were the hardest to put on. Be forceful. I used a 2"x4" to hammer, as I didn't have a rubber mallet. Don't short-change the sand. I "filled it up" and it still floated until I leaned it back and forth and got all the air out (as they show). When it's assembled and installed, it's beautiful. It's quite sturdy and is an elegant addition to our 27' above ground pool. No misgivings of any kind.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Welch

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Steps were delivered quickly without any visible damage. Easy to assemble. Only tools required are a rubber mallet and Phillips screwdriver. I assembled the steps by myself in about 30 min without any issues. I've owned several of these style of steps and this manufacturer is by far the best yet
customer_reviews.author: Larry Balestrino

customer_reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Pool stairs
customer_reviews.text: I bought the first stairs just to make sure it was what I wanted and I it was. I ordered the 2nd stairs for the inside of the pool and it's good as long as you have something to hold it down which I tied a 50lb weight to it and it works but I have to use something that won't rust. So I used milk gallons with sand and tied them down in the inside works fine. I Recommend these to anyone who was a above ground pool. The steps are good width.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Griffiths
